img.h1: Welcome to the Piedmont Unified School District
img.p: “Students Come First” in the Piedmont Schools. Educators work hard to provide all students with a comprehensive, rigorous and relevant K-12 curriculum. Parent participation in classrooms, on fieldtrips, on boards and committees is very high. Residents demonstrate their commitment to education in a variety of ways, but most importantly, through a parcel tax contributing approximately $9.0 million, nearly one third of the district budget, yearly.

strong.a: See what’s on the Board of Education’s agenda

h3.span: Measure H1 – Piedmont School Improvement/Modernization Bond

img.p: On June 22, 2016 the Piedmont Unified School District Board of Education voted unanimously to approve ballot language for a $66M facilities improvement bond for the November 8, 2016 ballot.

strong.a: Learn more about Measure H1 – Piedmont School Improvement/Modernization Bond »

img.p: The Facilities Master Plan process combines the goals of PUSD’s Education Specifications and the information collected by the design team (including facility assessments) into a comprehensive plan for the schools of the Piedmont Unified School District. The main product of the facility needs assessment and Facilities Master Plan is a detailed proposal for renovations and/or additions to be made at each school campus.

strong.a: Learn more about Facilities Master Planning Process »

h5.a: Board of Education Designates District Construction Projects As An Essential Governmental Function

div.p: On April 1, 2020, the PUSD Board of Education Designated the District Construction Projects as an Essential Government Project by Approving Resolution 21-2019-20.

h5.a: Witter Field is Closed Until Further Notice

div.p: To help slow the spread of the COVID-19 virus, the Piedmont Unified School District has temporarily closed school facilities, including the Witter Field Complex.
